meanings.definition: To soil or tarnish the reputation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Gossiping about others can lead to besmirching their good name.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations were aimed at besmirching his character.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enjoyed besmirching the bird feeder with mud.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's spray paint cans seemed to dance, besmirching the blank wall with color.
meanings.sent5: The online trolls were experts at besmirching the reputation of innocent people.

meanings.sent1: The rainstorm left mud besmirching the once clean sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The careless painter accidentally spilled paint, besmirching the pristine canvas.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy had a habit of besmirching the white carpet with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph had faded, besmirching the memories it held.
meanings.sent5: The pollution from the factory smokestacks was besmirching the clear blue sky.
